channel.title: Cant sleep until like 6-7am
channel.description:
This goes on quite often, my doctor prescribed me melatonin it doesn't loveing work though and she won't give me anything stronger because it can mess me up later on in life she says.
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/jauivk.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile

Or you could get into a routine where you simply allow half an hour to lay in bed, in darkness before trying to actually sleep? Relax, think, etc so that your body doesn’t keep you awake.

item.title: Cant sleep until like 6-7am
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Actually, your body doesn’t “need” heroin to function. Inhibitory neurotransmitters are usually released, and these neurotransmitters prevent dopamine neurotransmitters from being released into the synapse. When the dopamine neurotransmitters aren’t released, the dopamine receptor is not triggered and so there is no effect. However, when the body’s natural opiates activate opiate receptors, the release of inhibitory neurotransmitters is stopped and therefore dopamine is not inhibited and is released. Heroin merely mimics the natural opiates, turning off the release of the inhibitory neurotransmitters and so releasing dopamine. The human body will then get used to this increased level of dopamine and will begin to crave it, because such a level will not be reached in everyday life.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

I wonder how addictive gaming is compared to these things, in a graph form ;o. Shame this graph was inaccurate :c.

You need to separate two types of addiction. If you are addicted to heroin, your body needs heroin to function. People who are addicted to coffee gets withdrawal symptoms if they stop drinking. I’m sure you are just getting bored if you not play for a while.

item.title: Cant sleep until like 6-7am
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:30, topic:470367”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=587794.msg4170929#msg4170929 date=1354321636]
Also, your brain wakes itself up when it sees bright lights to stop people from falling asleep as easily in the sun and getting burnt badly, its a survival instinct. Therefore, if you use your phone or laptop and then try to sleep straight away after, it’ll be hard.

nah heroin is about the same as weed


[/quote]
nah heroin is the same as weed

and lol @ that graph how anabolic steroids came at the bottom, the risks of those are insane but not immediate[/quote]

You know that weed isn’t physically addictive, right? It can be psychologically addictive but not physically addictive. On this point, anything can be psychologically addictive. If people play Xbox when they’re upset to take their mind off their sadness, and it becomes a constant “fall back” routine, they are addicted to it. Also, anabolic steroids are not “at the bottom”, if you put as much effort into reading the pieces of data presented to you as you do into being sarcastic and having an “I’m right, you’re wrong” attitude, you might learn something.

You have yet to present one piece of data to support your opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant sleep until like 6-7am
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

Frell:

I don’t think any drug that can take control of you should be decriminalized. Its one of those times where recreational use only once will ruin your life.

Dependence is not caused by one time use of the drug, dependence is caused when your body is exposed to enough of the drug to alter brain chemistry. Where it becomes a need rather than a want. Once dependent there’s no reversing that state, basically once an addict forever an addict. But becoming an addict from trying a illicit substance once is ridiculous, I would like to see this wonder drug that you are referring too that hooks people both psychologically and physiologically after one use.

Read full topic
